thread.title: Cilic retains Kremlin Cup title, beating Bautista Agut
thread.title_full: Cilic retains Kremlin Cup title, beating Bautista Agut

title: Cilic retains Kremlin Cup title, beating Bautista Agut
text:
Cilic retains Kremlin Cup title, beating Bautista Agut in repeat of last year's final THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   10:53   10:54   
People: 
Eastern Europe (362) 

MOSCOW — Marin Cilic retained his title at the Kremlin Cup, beating Roberto Bautista Agut 6-4, 6-4 in a repeat of last year's final — and the same score. 
The big-hitting Croatian came under pressure in the early stages but soon took control, breaking Bautista Agut's serve at 3-3 before closing out the first set. 
Cilic went a break up at 2-2 in the second before saving two break points in the next game to hold his advantage. 
It is the 14th career title for Cilic, while Spain's Bautista Agut drops to a 2-3 record in tour finals. 
It was the first final for both players since they met last year in Moscow.
